title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Meteorologists declared a blizzard in parts of Massachusetts and Rhode Island, including Boston and Providence, as of Monday morning.
Blizzard conditions involve visibility under 1/4 mile for three hours with winds of 35 mph, not just heavy snow.
The National Weather Service issued a blizzard warning, predicting wind gusts up to 75 mph and potential power outages.

title: Video captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Photographer Jack Coen documented intense blizzard conditions in downtown Boston, including fierce winds and near-whiteout snow bursts.
Snowfall in Pawtucket, R.I., reached 14 inches early Monday, affecting roads and parking at 1Lofts mill apartments.
The National Weather Service warned of 18 to 24 inches of snow and damaging wind gusts in some areas of Massachusetts.

title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tom Brady's comments on Logan Paul's podcast about WWE being 'cute' have caught Randy Orton's attention.
Randy Orton expressed a desire to perform his signature RKO move on Tom Brady after Brady's playful WWE comments.
Brady and several NFL stars, including Saquon Barkley and Rob Gronkowski, will compete in the Fanatics Flag Football Classic.

title: These were Monday’s highest reported wind gusts during the storm in Mass.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Wellfleet on Cape Cod recorded the highest wind gust at 83 mph during Monday's storm in Massachusetts.
Multiple locations in Barnstable County experienced wind gusts exceeding 70 mph, signaling blizzard conditions.
Wind speeds at various Massachusetts airports, such as New Bedford AP and Logan AP, ranged from 58 to 65 mph.

title: LeBron James on Jaylen Brown’s MVP chances: ‘I don’t understand’ why he’s not being talked about
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: LeBron James questions why Jaylen Brown is not seriously considered for MVP despite averaging 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, 4.9 assists.
Celtics are second in the Eastern Conference; Brown trails five players in MVP race, including Luka Doncic and Nikola Jokic.
The Celtics have exceeded expectations despite key player absences, with Brown's performance as a motivator for the team.

title: Wachusett delayed opening, ski resorts putting lifts on wind hold
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Wachusett Mountain in Princeton delayed opening due to a powerful norâ€™easter, with lifts starting at 11 a.m.
Gov. Maura Healey declared a state of emergency in Massachusetts as 60-70 mph winds and heavy snow hit the region.
Wind holds affected ski areas like Mount Snow and Gunstock, with adjustments in lift operations across New England.

title: Photo scroll: Blizzard whips across Mass. with heavy snow, high winds
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A massive snowstorm hit the Northeast, with predictions of over 2 feet of snow in some regions.
Areas around Boston experienced high winds and heavy snowfall, causing disruptions and early store closures.
Images captured scenes of people navigating snowy streets and plows working to clear roads across Massachusetts.

title: Market Basket stores in Mass. close early Monday due to the blizzard
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Market Basket closed over 50 Massachusetts stores early due to a blizzard, citing safety concerns for workers and customers.
Several New Hampshire and Rhode Island Market Basket locations also closed early, while Maine stores largely remained open.
The closures impacted most locations, with exceptions in cities like Concord and Claremont, New Hampshire remaining operational.

title: Share your blizzard photos with Boston.com
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: A blizzard with whiteout conditions and strong winds is impacting the Northeast, including Massachusetts.
Snowfall is already in the double digits in some Massachusetts communities as the storm progresses.
Boston.com invites readers to submit blizzard photos for potential feature in upcoming articles.

title: Did you have to go into work during the blizzard?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Governor Maura Healey declared a state of emergency in Massachusetts and activated the National Guard due to the blizzard.
Some employers still required non-essential employees to work in-person despite the state of emergency and work-from-home capabilities.
Certain companies provided resources like hotel accommodations for employees who needed to work in-person during the blizzard.
